of other guys got together at nitobe and U you know just after Steve Jobs announced the iPhone and said that we're
going to write web apps we were cheering and then a year later he he gifted us Objective C SDK called the iPhone SDK
and a lot of people were happy about that but we weren't among them um but we found out that you could embed a web
browser and we thought that was pretty cool uh fast forward to today uh or a few years later uh an adobe was
acquiring a company that we worked at called nitobe and nit toi had been working on phone
gap for three years at that point and we had a really good rigorous open source
contribution process whereby we had an inbound license um called a contributor license agreement and a contributor
license agreement is basically a way of a contributor saying I agreed to the terms of the outbound license and I'm
granting you this code under that copyright and that's great except for that inbound licensing named nitobe and
nitobe was about to get bought by Adobe and we had contributors from IBM and Intel and Microsoft and IBM Intel and
Microsoft and others weren't really thrilled about the idea of a whole bunch of Ip um that they had contributed
suddenly being owned by Adobe and so we worked at the Apache software Foundation to donate all the source code of phone
Gap um to them uh they didn't want the name they wanted a clean slate and so
effectively phap in 2011 became Apache Cordova and the name phone Gap became a
downstream of Apache Cordova and so this is very much like I don't know webkit and uh and blink
that kind of thing it's just a different name for the same thing effectively Cordova's become a lot higher level or
sorry lower level and phone Gap has become a lot higher level uh adobe's agenda with phone Gap is to kind of
bring it to designers and uh people who may not necessarily code full-time so people that are more in their creative
realm and Cordova is remaining very low level and it's a toolkit for building apps using HTML CSS and JavaScript which
is what we're we're all about MH in Practical terms um if you're using
Cordova you're essentially doing your compiling locally and so you need to have the Android SDK installed and the
iOS SDK installed and it will detect it and it will like do the compiling for
you um whereas phone Gap will actually move your assets up to the cloud and and do the build on the server so if you
